div.p: 1. The general word for a well-attuned state obtaining between a multiplicity of elements, prototypically sounds, is hé 和.
2. Tóng 同 refers to external adjusted conformity as opposed to inner adjustment and harmony.
3. Xié 協 and the much rarer jí 輯 and mù 睦 refer primarily to harmonious social cooperation.
4. Chèn 稱 is to bring primarily weights, and by extension other features, into proper harmony and exact balance.
5. Tiáo 調 is primarily to blend harmoniously edibles, and by extension the harmonious blending of anything to produce a pleasing whole.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Anthologia sive Florilegium rerum et materiarum selectarum
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典
New Dictiornary of the History of Ideas, 6 vols.

Bibliographisches Handbuch zur Sprachinhaltsforschung. Teil II. Systematischer Teil. B. Ordnung nach Sinnbezirken (mit einem alphabetischen Begriffsschluessel): Der Mensch und seine Welt im Spiegel der Sprachforschung

entry.def: Xié 協 and the much rarer jí 輯 and mù 睦 refer primarily to harmonious social cooperation. See also COOPERATE
Tóng 同 refers to external adjusted conformity as opposed to inner adjustment and harmony. xxx

sense.def: conform with something, adjust to something, come to coexist with something
harmony in unity with something; harmonious coexistence or conformity
adjust oneself to the contextually determinate N, assimilate oneself to the contextually determinate N

entry.def: The general word for bringing something into a state where it is well in tune or keeping in tune with something is hé 和.

sense.def: start to be harmoniuos, start to be well ballanced
harmony; natural balance; cohesion; harmonious internal relations
be conciliatory, be harmonious, be in harmonious good order; be concordant; be well balanced
be in continuous harmony through or with
be in harmony with; comply nicely with; stay in harmony with;
establish harmonious relations with; make harmonious, bring proper harmony to; pacify
not be in harmony with each other
be in harmony with one another
pleasing harmony of composition and character
harmonise with, be in accord with the contextually determinate object

entry.def: Xié 協 and the much rarer jí 輯 and mù 睦 refer primarily to harmonious social cooperation.

sense.def: show mutual respect and a harmonious spirit
be on good terms with the contextually determinate N
be on good terms with N

entry.def: Chèn 稱 is to bring primarily weights, and by extension other features, into proper harmony and exact balance.

sense.def: weigh against; balance out; match up to

entry.def: Tiáo 調 is primarily to blend harmoniously edibles, and by extension the harmonious blending of anything to produce a pleasing whole.

sense.def: to be properly blended, be in harmony, be in tune; be properly atuned; more generally: be geared towards
to blend properly, to make harmonious; tune up (instruments); attune (e.g. one's speech to circumstances etc)
cause to be in tune/tune an instrument
be unruffled and unperturbed, be smooth

entry.def: Xié 協 and the much rarer jí 輯 and mù 睦 refer primarily to harmonious social cooperation.

sense.def: GUOYU: be collaborative, be in harmony
harmonuous, be in harmony, be in accordance with each other
live in harmony with each other; be in perfect harmony
be in a state of complete harmony
adjust properly, get into harmonious good shape
be very much in harmonious accord; thrive in harmony
be mutually generous towards, cultivate harmonious relations with (each other) 相能
SHU: bring harmony to 親九族
